intro: Olyra scrobiculata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm, with dark green, velvety leaves that are often marked with silver or white veins. Its flowers are usually violet or purple, with five petals and a distinctive corona, and it blooms throughout the year under proper care. Olyra scrobiculata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
